titlestmt.titleproper: Lowell, Mass. Eliot Union Church records, 1830-1969.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday February 15, 2024 at 20:58

did.unittitle: Lowell, Mass. Eliot Union Church records, 1830-1969.
did.abstract: The Appleton Congregational Church in Lowell, Massachusetts, was organized in 1830. In 1873, the church building was sold to the First Presbyterian Church and the church moved to a new building along Eliot Street to become the Eliot Street Church. The Kirk Street Church was organized in 1845. In 1919, the Eliot and Kirk Street Churches merged to form the Eliot Union Church. In 1955, the Eliot Union Church merged with the First Presbyterian Church to form the Eliot Presbyterian Church. The collection contains church administrative records, membership records, auxiliary group records, and scrapbooks.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Lowell, Mass. Eliot Union Church records, 1830-1969, RG0113. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Some Kirk Street Church materials were deposited at an undetermined date before 1981. The majority of the collection was donated to the Congregational Library & Archive by the Eliot Presbyterian Church in November, 1991; no accession number.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was initially processed circa 1995. The collection was reprocessed by Zachary Bodnar, February 2024, according to Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Appleton Congregational Church in Lowell, Massachusetts, also known as the Second Congregational Church, was organized in 1830. The church's meeting house was located along Appleton Street. In 1873 the church building was sold to the First Presbyterian Church and a new church building was constructed at the corner of Eliot and Summer Streets. At this point, the church changed its name to Eliot Church.

The Kirk Street Church, also known as the Fourth Congregational Church, was organized in 1845. The church was initially poor with a fairly young membership. The church building was given to the town of Lowell to make way for a high school in 1916.

The Eliot Church and Kirk Street Church merged in 1919 to form the Eliot Union Church. This church continued to worship at the Eliot Street location. In 1955 the Eliot Union Church merged with the First Presbyterian Church to form the Eliot Presbyterian Church. The old Appleton Street Church was given to the Salvation Army after the merger of First Presbyterian and Eliot Union Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Eliot Union Church, in Lowell, Massachusetts, as well as the records of the two churches that merged to form the Eliot Union Church: the Eliot Church and the Kirk Street Church. The collection contains church administrative records, such as financial records and meeting minutes, membership records, including baptismal records and marriage records, auxiliary group records, and scrapbooks that document the weekly activities of the church.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been arranged into the three series listed below. The Kirk Street Church records series has been further divided into three subseries. The collection has generally been arranged into chronological order. Some closely related materials, and materials which begin where a previous item ended, have been topically grouped together within the chronological order to assist discoverability.
Subseries 2: Membership and auxiliary group records, 1845-1919

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Eliot Church. These records include church records, membership records, records relating to a pastor's Bible class, an address authored by John M. Greene, records for the King's Daughters auxiliary group (continued in the Eliot Union Church records), and a leaflet that describes the value of the church's building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of the Kirk Street Church. The records include administrative records, such as church records and financial records, membership records, including vital records, Sunday school records, auxiliary group records, and scrapbooks. The scrapbooks document weekly activities at the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the administration of the Kirk Street Church and contains both church records and financial records. The church records largely document the administrative history of the church and contain meeting minutes. The financial records document the finances of the church and also include records related to the church building and pews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the membership, and member activities, of the Kirk Street Church. This subseries also contains records related to the Kirk Street Sunday school and Christian Endeavour auxiliary group. The membership records contain marriage records, baptismal records, and records of admission and dismission. The Sunday school records contain information about students as well as records about the administration of the Sunday school. The Christian Endeavour records contain the meeting minutes for the group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains scrapbooks created by the Kirk Street Church. These scrapbooks document the near weekly activities and happenings at the church. The scrapbooks primarily contain newspaper clippings and Sunday service programs. The scrapbooks also contain various ephemera created for various programs, events, and gatherings held at the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of the Eliot Union Church. The records largely start in 1919, when the Eliot and Kirk Street churches merged, but a few record books begin prior to the merger. The membership records, in particular, appear to contain copies of earlier records. This series contains church and administrative records, membership records, auxiliary group records, as well as miscellaneous ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains ephemera related to the First Presbyterian Church in Lowell. The First Presbyterian Church and Eliot Union Church merged in 1956. The folder contains two photographs in glass of the church's exterior, a 1933 service of dedication program, a seventy-fifth anniversary program, a one hundredth anniversary program, an in memoriam for Rev. Robert Court, and an explainer, with photographs, for the "Historic Windows" of the church.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The "Miscellaneous church records, 1931-1954" were removed from this volume for preservation purposes. The item was removed from the back of the book.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The "Poems, undated" were removed from this volume for preservation purposes. The item was removed from page 55.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials in this folder were removed from the "Church records, 1919-1953" for preservation purposes. This item was found in the very back of that record book.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials in this folder were removed from the "Committee records, 1921-1928" for preservation purposes. This item was found on page 55 of that record book.
